p: Use AES-256 when it is necessary to protect data with symmetric encryption.
Using strong encryption algorithms helps prevent unauthorized disclosure of sensitive information.
Use Java cryptographic APIs. Scala cryptographic APIs are available in the *.crypto.* classes.
Write cryptographic utility functions that use minimum AES-256. Write functions that generate keys, encrypt, and decrypt data.
Use the utility functions. Use the cryptographic utility functions whenever data needs to be encrypted or decrypted using symmetric cryptography.

strong: Write cryptographic utility functions that use minimum AES-256.

html:
Applies to

Scala and Play Framework 2.1.0+

    What to Do

    Use AES-256 when it is necessary to protect data with symmetric encryption.

    Why

    Using strong encryption algorithms helps prevent unauthorized disclosure of sensitive information.

    How

    To use strong symmetric encryption:

    1. Use Java cryptographic APIs. Scala cryptographic APIs are available in the *.crypto.* classes.

    2. Write cryptographic utility functions that use minimum AES-256. Write functions that generate keys, encrypt, and decrypt data. 

    3. Use the utility functions. Use the cryptographic utility functions whenever data needs to be encrypted or decrypted using symmetric cryptography.
